To sort this array using insertion sorting with a maximum allowed time complexity of O(n log n), we can follow these steps:

Step 0: Initialize two pointers i = 0 (start) and j = len(arr)-1 (end). This will be our left pointer to start from the first element.

Step 1: While both pointers are within bounds:
    - If arr[i] > arr[j], swap them. 
        - Swap by swapping elements at indices i+1 and j.
            - Here's how it works for example if you have [7,8,9]. The last index after swapping would become either 'i' or 'j', depending on which one has smaller value initially
- Move right pointer towards end until they meet up again

Here’s Python code implementation of above approach:

```python
def insert_sort(arr):
    
    # Insertion Sort Algorithm
    
    def merge(left,right):   # Merge function 
    
        result=[]          # Result list
        
        while True:       # Loop till no items remaining in any side 
        
            less_left=min(len(left),len(right))     # Get min length between lists
            
            temp=left[:less_left]+right[left:]      # Create new merged list 
            
            result.extend(temp)
            
            if len(result)==max(len(left)+len(right)): break         # Break when all item were added into final sorted list
            
        
        return result


    def mergesort(lists):

        if len(lists)<=1: return lists[:] 

        mid=len(lists)//2           # Find middle point where spliting happens
        l=lists[:mid]
        r=lists[mid:]

        l.sort()                 # Sorting L part
        r.sort()

        return merge(merge(l,r))

arr=[4,5,2,1,3]

print("Sorted Array:",mergesort(insert_sort(arr)))
```

To start building your own homemade composting system you will need several essential items:

- Compost bin liner material

Add layers of organic matter like straw, leaves, grass clippings, coffee grounds, etc., until they cover half of the top edge of your container. This process can take anywhere between two weeks to one month depending on climate conditions.

Step 4: Turn Your Bin Regularly
Turn your bin every few days by gently pushing down on the sides with your hands. This helps aerate the pile and prevents odors buildup.

Step 5: Keep Adding Organic Matter
Continue to add more organic matter gradually throughout the year. You may want to consider starting small first before expanding out if necessary.

def calculate_average(input_list):
